curam.util.persistence
Class DAOReadmultiOperation<E extends Entity<?>>

java.lang.Object
  curam.util.persistence.DAOReadmultiOperation<E>
Type Parameters:
E - the type of entity being retrieved and operated on.
public abstract class DAOReadmultiOperation<E extends Entity<?>>
extends java.lang.Object

A Curam "readmulti" operation is one which retrieves multiple rows from the application database. Each entity's readmulti operations comes in two forms - the simplest of these returns all of the target database rows as a vector in memory. The second form takes an instance of ReadmultiOperation which is called for each of the rows in the target result set. This allows developers to produce their own custom processing for result sets, without ever having to assemble the entire result set in memory at one time.

When subclassing ReadmultiOperation, you must provide an implementation of the "operation" method, which is called for each entity instance in the result set. All other methods are optional.

See Also:
ReadmultiOperation

Constructor Detail

DAOReadmultiOperation

public DAOReadmultiOperation()
Method Detail

filter

public boolean filter(E entity)
               throws AppException,
                      InformationalException
Called with each entity of the result set. If filter() returns true, then the row is passed to the operation() method, otherwise it is discarded. filter() can be used to implement conditional logic in a ReadmultiOperation separately from the business logic in the operation() method which operates on the unfiltered entities. The default filter operation returns "true", indicating that the result row SHOULD be passed to operation().

Parameters:
entity - The entity instance retrieved from the database.
Returns:
True if the row should be passed to the operation() method.
Throws:
AppException - Hook to allow for subclassed operation exceptions.
InformationalException - Generic Exception Signature.
See Also:
ReadmultiOperation.filter(Object)

first

public void first(E entity)
           throws AppException,
                  InformationalException
Called with the FIRST row of a result set. Note that first is called as long as there is at least one row in the result set, regardless of whether or not filter() returns true for this row. The default first() operation does nothing.

Parameters:
entity - The first entity instance retrieved from the database.
Throws:
AppException - Hook to allow for subclassed operation exceptions.
InformationalException - Generic Exception Signature.
See Also:
ReadmultiOperation.first(Object)

getMaximum

public int getMaximum()
Provides the maximum number of rows that should be returned by a readmulti operation. 0 is a special case meaning all rows should be returned. If more rows are present than the maximum a ReadmultiMaxException is thrown by the data access code.

Returns:
The maximum number of rows that should be returned by a readmulti operation. The default is zero.
See Also:
ReadmultiOperation.getMaximum()

onMaximumReached

public void onMaximumReached()
                      throws ReadmultiMaxException,
                             InformationalException
Behavior required when the maximum numbers of records have been reached.

Throws:
ReadmultiMaxException - ReadmultiMaxException - the default behavior here is to throw a ReadmultiMaxException. This can be overridden in sub-classes of ReadmultiOperation.
InformationalException - Generic Exception Signature.
See Also:
ReadmultiOperation.onMaximumReached()

operation

public abstract boolean operation(E entity)
                           throws AppException,
                                  InformationalException
Called with each entity of the result set for which filter() returns true. If operation() returns false, the readmulti process stops at that point, and no more rows are passed to operation(). The default operation() is abstract, and thus MUST be implemented by subclasses.

Parameters:
entity - The entity instance retrieved from the database.
Returns:
A flag indicating that the readmulti should continue. Implementations should normally return true.
Throws:
AppException - Hook to allow for subclassed operation exceptions.
InformationalException - Generic Exception Signature.
See Also:
ReadmultiOperation.operation(Object)

post

public void post()
          throws AppException,
                 InformationalException
Called after the last row has been passed to the operation() method. The default implementation does nothing.

Throws:
AppException - Hook to allow for subclassed operation exceptions.
InformationalException - Generic Exception Signature.
See Also:
ReadmultiOperation.post()

pre

public void pre()
         throws AppException,
                InformationalException
Called before the first row has been passed to the operation() method. The default implementation does nothing.

Throws:
AppException - Hook to allow for subclassed operation exceptions.
InformationalException - Generic Exception Signature.
See Also:
ReadmultiOperation.pre()

requireInformational

public boolean requireInformational()
Returns whether the informationalRequired parameter has been set in the constructor of this Operation.

Boolean indicating if the informationalRequired parameter has been set.
